intro: Aster laevis, commonly known as the smooth aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the late summer and early fall. The plant has slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves that are smooth to the touch. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Aster laevis is also valued for its ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
